title: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 2 LIVE | Liberalism and Hinduism are totally compatible, says Shashi Tharoor - The Hindu
summary:
The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 2 LIVE | Liberalism and Hinduism are totally compatible, says Shashi Tharoor

Date: January 19, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 is hosting engaging discussions about various topics including the 2024 General Elections and the Chola empire. Notable speakers include Shashi Tharoor and Rajdeep Sardesai.

  • Shashi Tharoor emphasized that liberalism and Hinduism are compatible beliefs.
  • Tharoor intends to reclaim Hinduism from narrow political interpretations.
  • The event features discussions on socio-political contexts and the significance of personal and political identities.
“The personal is there in the political, and the political is there in the personal.” - Aruna Roy

The event underscores the importance of conversations around culture, politics, and societal norms as The Hindu Lit for Life continues to curate intellectually stimulating dialogues.
newTitle: Liberalism and Hinduism Are Totally Compatible, Says Shashi Tharoor at The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 2

title: Maha Kumbh 2025: Viral 'IITian Baba' Abhey Singh expelled from Juna Akhara - The Times of India
summary:
Maha Kumbh 2025: Viral 'IITian Baba' Abhey Singh Expelled from Juna Akhara

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a surprising twist at the Maha Kumbh 2025, Abhey Singh, popularly known as the 'IITian Baba,' has been expelled from the Juna Akhara for undisclosed reasons. The move has sparked significant discussion across social media platforms.

  • Abhey Singh gained fame for his unorthodox approach combining spirituality with an IIT background.
  • His activities drew a large following, bringing diverse attention to the Kumbh gathering.
  • The expulsion raises questions about the governance and traditions within religious sects.
"This event highlights the evolving dynamics of religious leadership and popular culture within the Kumbh."

The expulsion of Abhey Singh has ignited debates on the intersection of modernity and tradition, showcasing the challenges faced by religious institutions today.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh 2025: Viral 'IITian Baba' Abhey Singh Expelled from Juna Akhara

Woman tourist, instructor die in paragliding accident in North Goa: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Woman tourist and instructor die in paragliding accident in North Goa: Report

Date: Jan 19, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic paragliding accident in North Goa claimed the lives of a 27-year-old woman tourist from Pune and her Nepalese instructor, highlighting ongoing safety concerns in adventure sports.

  • The accident occurred at Keri Plateau, Goa, when their paraglider crashed into a ravine.
  • Shivani Dable was paragliding with an illegal operator named Shekhar Raizada.
  • A case has been registered for endangering human life.
  • This incident follows similar paragliding fatalities in Himachal Pradesh within 24 hours.
“The paraglider plunged into a ravine soon after it took off from a cliff.”

This incident raises serious safety concerns regarding paragliding regulations and the operation of adventure sports companies.
newTitle: Woman tourist and instructor killed in North Goa paragliding accident

title: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 2 LIVE: he intra-alliance dissonance strikes with voters: Rajdeep Sardesai on infighting within INDIA alliance - The Hindu
summary:
The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 2 LIVE: Earth is hurtling towards disaster, says Dr. Soumya Swaminathan

Date & Source: Published - January 19, 2025

The second day of The Hindu Lit for Life focuses on important discussions intended to address key issues surrounding the 2024 General Elections and environmental challenges, notably emphasized by Dr. Soumya Swaminathan.

  • Dr. Soumya Swaminathan warns that Earth is on a catastrophic path due to interconnected issues such as loss of biodiversity and pollution.
  • Discussion on the concept of 'One Health', linking human, animal, and environmental health.
  • Prominent speakers included Rajdeep Sardesai, discussing political dissonance and the current electoral climate.
  • Historical insights into the Chola empire discussed by Anirudh Kanisetti.
“Earth is hurtling towards disaster, mainly due to loss of biodiversity.” - Dr. Soumya Swaminathan

This event continues to shed light on the relationship between societal health and environmental preservation, with urgency in addressing these global challenges.
newTitle: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 2 LIVE: Earth is hurtling towards disaster, says Dr. Soumya Swaminathan

summary:
Donald Trump's India Visit: PM Modi’s White House Invite Possible Soon

Date: Jan 19, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Donald Trump, soon to be inaugurated as US President, is considering visits to India and China, with plans for a possible meeting with PM Modi at the White House in spring.

  • Trump has discussed a trip to India possibly in April or later this year.
  • Discussions were held with Indian officials prior to the inauguration concerning strengthening bilateral relations.
  • Trump aims to deepen ties with China as well, amidst previous threats regarding tariffs.
“I just spoke to Chairman Xi Jinping of China. It is my expectation that we will solve many problems together, and starting immediately.” - Donald Trump

title: Saif Ali Khan attack case: Mumbai Police arrests accused from Thane - The Hindu
Centre-farmer talks on Feb 14, fasting Dallewal agrees to medical aid - The Tribune India
summary:
Centre-farmer talks on Feb 14, fasting Dallewal agrees to medical aid

Publication Date: February 2023

Source: The Tribune

The Centre has invited farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal for talks aimed at potentially concluding the year-long farmers' protest, during which he has been fasting for 54 days. Dallewal has agreed to undergo medical treatment upon pleas from fellow farmers.

  • Dallewal invited to talks on February 14 in Chandigarh.
  • He has been fasting for 54 days at the Khanauri border.
  • The government has conditioned discussions on Dallewal agreeing to treatment.
  • Protesting farmers are considering a proposal from the Centre regarding their demands.
  • Over 40 farmers have reportedly died during the protests.
“We have received a decent proposal and are discussing its modalities.” - Kaka Singh Kotra

This meeting marks the first formal dialogue since February of the previous year amid ongoing protests against the government's agricultural policies.
newTitle: Centre and Farmer Leader Dallewal to Meet on February 14 Amid Ongoing Protests

title: Fadnavis first Maha CM to become guardian minister - The Times of India
summary:
Fadnavis first Maha CM to become guardian minister

Publication Date: Not specified & Source: Times of India

Devendra Fadnavis has made history by becoming the first Chief Minister of Maharashtra to take on the role of guardian minister. This significant move is expected to enhance governance and community relations.

  • Fadnavis announces his commitment to improve local governance.
  • The decision aims to deepen the connection between the government and citizens.
  • This role is expected to engage with various community concerns directly.
“I am deeply honored to take on this role and will work tirelessly for the betterment of our citizens,” Fadnavis stated.

This appointment reflects Fadnavis's continuous effort to strengthen ties with the public and address local issues effectively.
newTitle: Fadnavis Becomes First Maharashtra CM to Assume Guardian Minister Role

title: PM Modi: Property cards under SVAMITVA will unlock economic activity worth over Rs 100 lakh crore - The Indian Express
summary:
PM Modi: Property cards under SVAMITVA will unlock economic activity worth over Rs 100 lakh crore

Date: Saturday
Source: Official Announcement

Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that the property cards issued under the SVAMITVA scheme will ensure economic security and unlock significant economic activity across rural India.

  • Over 65 lakh property cards distributed across 50,000 villages in 230 districts.
  • Approximately 2.25 crore rural residents have received legal documentation for their properties.
  • The implementation of the scheme has been linked to facilitating loans for small businesses among rural families.
  • Modi highlighted that the scheme aims to alleviate the issues faced by Dalit, backward, and tribal families against illegal property occupation.
  • The expected economic activity to be unlocked through this initiative is estimated to be over Rs 100 lakh crore.
“After getting legal documents, lakhs of people have taken loans from banks on the basis of their houses and property.”

The Prime Minister emphasized the importance of property rights in reducing poverty and criticized past governments for failing to address property ownership issues.
newTitle: PM Modi: Property cards under SVAMITVA will unlock economic activity worth over Rs 100 lakh crore

title: Centre invites farmers for talks, Dallewal agrees to take medical aid - The Indian Express
summary:
Centre Invites Farmers for Talks as Dallewal Agrees to Medical Aid

Publication Date: January 18, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

The Centre has invited farmers for talks next month to discuss their demands, a move aimed at resolving the ongoing farmers' protest. Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been fasting, accepted medical aid on the same day he was invited for a meeting.

  • The meeting for discussions is scheduled for February 14 at the Mahatma Gandhi Institute of Public Administration in Chandigarh.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal was on a fast unto death since November 26 last year.
  • The invitation follows a meeting between Dallewal and officials from the Union Agriculture Ministry.
  • Over 121 farmers joined Dallewal on hunger strike at the Khanauri border.
“If 121 farmers sitting on hunger strike tell me, I will take medical assistance but will not take any food until the demands, including the most important one seeking MSP as a legal guarantee, are not met.” – Jagjit Singh Dallewal

The discussions are seen as crucial as the protests continue. The significant health concerns over Dallewal were acknowledged, prompting the Centre's outreach.
newTitle: Centre Invites Farmers for Talks as Dallewal Agrees to Medical Aid

title: No Fish, Meat Or Any Non-Veg Food To Be Sold In Bengaluru's Yelahanka For A Month | Here's Why - News18
summary:
No Fish, Meat Or Any Non-Veg Food To Be Sold In Bengaluru's Yelahanka For A Month | Here's Why

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: News18

The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has prohibited the sale of meat, fish, and non-vegetarian items within a 13 km radius of Air Force Station Yelahanka from January 23 to February 17, 2025, preparing for the Aero India-2025 show.

  • The Aero India show is scheduled from February 10 to 14, 2025.
  • Prohibition on sale of non-veg items is a safety measure to avoid bird hits during aircraft practice.
  • The event aims to foster partnerships between Indian and foreign firms in the aerospace sector.
  • Violations of the order will attract penalties under relevant regulations.
Karnataka | Aero India-2025 show will be held at Airforce station Yelahanka from Feb 10 to 14. Due to this, sale of non-veg food is prohibited within 13 km radius of the Airforce station from Jan 23 to Feb 17: BBMP — ANI (@ANI) January 18, 2025

This measure is deemed necessary to ensure the safety of air operations during the event.
newTitle: No Fish, Meat Or Any Non-Veg Food To Be Sold In Bengaluru's Yelahanka For A Month | Here's Why

title: Centre to hold meeting with protesting farmers on February 14; Dallewal takes medical aid - The Hindu
summary:
Centre to Discuss Farmers' Demands on February 14 as Dallewal Receives Medical Aid

Published on: January 19, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

The Centre is set to hold a meeting with Punjab's protesting farmers on February 14 in Chandigarh, marking an effort to address their demands, including a legal guarantee for the minimum support price (MSP) for crops. Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been on a fast-unto-death for over 50 days, has agreed to receive medical aid but insists he will continue his protest.

  • The meeting is scheduled for 5 p.m. at the Mahatma Gandhi State Institute of Public Administration in Chandigarh.
  • Farmer leaders had urged Dallewal to take medical aid for his health before the meeting.
  • A high-level delegation from the Centre, led by Joint Secretary Priya Ranjan, has recently engaged with Dallewal and protesting farmer representatives.
  • Dallewal's fast began on November 26 last year, and he has lost significant weight, reducing from 86.9 kg to 66.4 kg.
  • The proposed meeting follows several inconclusive rounds of discussions between Union ministers and farmers over the past year.
“We urged him (Dallewal) to break his fast and take medical aid, so that he can participate in the meeting.” - Priya Ranjan, Joint Secretary of the Union Agriculture Ministry

The Centre's commitment to negotiating with the farmers implies a potential shift in the approach towards resolving the ongoing agitation.
newTitle: Centre to Discuss Farmers' Demands on February 14 as Dallewal Receives Medical Aid

Ousted From Juna Akhada? IIT Baba Makes Abrupt Exit From Maha Kumbh - News18
summary:
IIT Baba's Sudden Departure from Maha Kumbh Sparks Concerns

Date: January 19, 2025 Source: News18

The renowned 'IIT Baba,' Abhey Singh, has unexpectedly exited the Maha Kumbh festival, stirring concerns about his well-being amidst speculations of mental stress and media pressure.

  • Abhey Singh, a former aerospace engineer from IIT Bombay, made a name for himself at Maha Kumbh 2025 but has now vanished.
  • His disappearance has raised alarms among family and ashram members, as he has maintained distance from relatives for months.
  • Reportedly, Singh has faced mental stress and was said to have taken drugs due to this pressure from media interactions.
  • His unexpected exit has ignited discussions regarding internal conflicts within the Juna Akhada about his rising popularity.
  • Singh's journey from aerospace engineering to spirituality has captured public interest, prompting many to follow his story.
“You will keep searching for the meaning of life. I used to find that in engineering but never found my answers.” - Abhey Singh

This sudden turn of events has left many wondering about the implications of media influence on spiritual figures, as well as the potential personal struggles behind public personas.
newTitle: IIT Baba's Sudden Departure from Maha Kumbh Sparks Concerns

title: 65 lakh rural land owners across 50,000 villages get property cards - The Times of India
summary:
65 Lakh Rural Land Owners Across 50,000 Villages Get Property Cards

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

An extensive initiative has granted property cards to 65 lakh rural landowners across 50,000 villages in India, enhancing their land ownership rights and access to services.

  • The program aims to secure land rights for rural populations.
  • This initiative is a part of the government's efforts to digitize land records.
  • It is expected to improve access to credit for farmers.
"This initiative will empower rural landowners and boost the agricultural economy," a government official stated.

This significant step towards land rights aims to enhance the livelihoods of rural communities and streamline agricultural processes.
newTitle: 65 Lakh Rural Land Owners Across 50,000 Villages Get Property Cards

IPS G P Singh appointed Director General of CRPF - The Indian Express
summary:
G P Singh Appointed Director General of CRPF

Publication Date: January 19, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

The Centre has appointed Gyanendra Pratap Singh as the new Director General of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF). Singh, a senior IPS officer from the Assam-Meghalaya cadre, previously served as the Director General of Police in Assam.

  • G P Singh is a 1991-batch IPS officer.
  • He takes office following the retirement of Anish Dayal Singh.
  • Singh has a history of involvement in significant police operations and protests in Assam.
  • His tenure will last until November 30, 2027, or until further orders.
  • Singh has a notable social media presence with over 214.7k followers on X.
“Back to ASSAM…!!! The Karmabhumi.” - G P Singh after receiving his new role.

This appointment emphasizes the government's strategy in managing internal security through experienced personnel.
newTitle: G P Singh Appointed Director General of CRPF

title: Saif Ali Khan stabbing case: Mumbai Police arrests accused in Thane - The Times of India
summary:
Mumbai Police Arrests Suspect in Saif Ali Khan Stabbing Case

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: The Times of India

The recent stabbing case involving Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan has seen an arrest in Thane, as Mumbai Police continue their investigation.

  • The police apprehended a suspect connected to the stabbing incident.
  • Authorities are gathering evidence and statements from witnesses.
  • The attack reportedly occurred in a public area, raising safety concerns.
“We are determined to ensure the safety of public figures and citizens alike.” - Mumbai Police

Authorities remain vigilant as the case develops, emphasizing the commitment to security and public safety.
newTitle: Mumbai Police Arrests Suspect in Saif Ali Khan Stabbing Case

title: American podcaster Lex Fridman to host podcast with PM Modi in February - Hindustan Times
summary:
Lex Fridman to Host Podcast with PM Modi in February

Date: Jan 19, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

American podcaster Lex Fridman announced that he will host a podcast with Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the end of February. Fridman expressed excitement about visiting India for the first time.

  • Fridman has previously hosted figures such as Elon Musk, Donald Trump, and Zelenskyy on his podcast.
  • He aims to experience the vibrant culture and meet the people of India.
  • This podcast marks a significant moment as it is Modi's engagement in the podcasting space.
  • Fridman has over 4.5 million subscribers on his YouTube channel.
“I will be doing a podcast with Narendra Modi (@narendramodi), Prime Minister of India, at the end of February. I've never been to India, so I'm excited to finally visit and experience many facets of its vibrant, historic culture and its amazing people as fully as I can.” – Lex Fridman

The upcoming podcast is set to explore various topics, potentially including India's technological growth and leadership philosophies.
newTitle: Lex Fridman to Host Podcast with PM Modi in February

BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination From New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases, Assets - News18
summary:
BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination From New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases, Assets

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: News18

BJP candidate Parvesh Verma has filed a complaint challenging the nomination of former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for alleged income discrepancies, failure to disclose criminal cases, and voter registration issues.

  • Parvesh Verma's complaint seeks the cancellation of Kejriwal's nomination.
  • It highlights incorrect income figures reported by Kejriwal in his affidavits for the years 2019–23.
  • The complaint questions Kejriwal's voter registration status and notes that he has failed to disclose details of four FIRs against him.
  • Delhi Assembly elections for all 70 constituencies are scheduled for February 5, with results on February 8.
“Election commission will decide on it but since he is a public figure, this is a serious matter and should be investigated.” - Virendra Sachdeva, Delhi BJP President

Kejriwal has urged voters to focus on developmental work done by his party.
newTitle: BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination From New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases, Assets

title: 'Fuelled by jealousy': Bengaluru techie poisons woman, drinks toilet cleaner to evade arrest - The Times of India
summary:
Bengaluru Techie Commits Poisoning and Suicide Attempt Amid Jealousy

Publication Date: October 5, 2023 Source: Times of India

A tech employee in Bengaluru, driven by jealousy, has been accused of poisoning a woman he was in a relationship with, followed by an attempt to evade arrest by consuming toilet cleaner.

  • The incident has shocked the local community, raising concerns about relationship dynamics in the tech industry.
  • Authorities report the woman is currently in critical condition.
  • The perpetrator's actions reflect a growing trend of domestic violence fueled by personal disputes.
“Jealousy can lead to tragic outcomes when managed poorly,” a local psychologist commented.

This incident underscores the need for better awareness and support for individuals facing relationship issues.
newTitle: Bengaluru Techie Commits Poisoning and Suicide Attempt Amid Jealousy

title: Centre proposes meeting with protesting farmers on February 14 in Chandigarh - The Tribune India
summary:
Centre proposes meeting with protesting farmers on February 14 in Chandigarh

Publication Date: February 12, 2023 | Source: The Tribune

The Centre has invited protesting farmers for a meeting to discuss their demands, scheduled for February 14 in Chandigarh. The meeting follows concerns for a farmer leader who has been on a hunger strike for over 54 days.

  • The meeting will take place at the Mahatama Gandhi State Institute of Public Administration.
  • Priya Ranjan, Joint Secretary, led the delegation that invited farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal.
  • Dallewal is urging the acceptance of farmers' demands through his fast.
  • Farmer leaders have encouraged Dallewal to seek medical assistance to attend the meeting.
“I hope Dallewal will break his fast and participate in talks,” said a government official.

This proposed dialogue marks a crucial step in addressing the farmers' long-standing concerns and health risks posed by ongoing protests.
newTitle: Centre proposes meeting with protesting farmers on February 14 in Chandigarh
